intro: Lithospermum fulvidulum, commonly known as the yellow lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-gray hue, while its roots contain compounds used in traditional medicine. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its vibrant floral display.
